sen.j: 橘 広相（たちばな の ひろみ、承和 (日本)4年（837年） - 寛平2年5月16日 (旧暦)（890年6月10日））は、平安時代前期の公卿・学者。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Hiromi (837-June 10, 890) was the Kugyo (the top court official) and academian in the early Heian era.
TACHIBANA no Hiromi (837-June 10, 890) was a Kugyo (top court official) and academian in the early Heian Era.

sen.j: 橘氏長者・阿波国守橘峯範の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of TACHIBANA no Minenori, who held titles of Tachibanashi choja (chieftain of the Tachibana family) and Awa no kuni no kami (the lord of Awa Province).

sen.cmt: 阿波国守→Awa no kuni no kami (Governor of Awa Province) としました。

sen.j: 子に、橘公材、橘公頼、橘義子（宇多天皇女御）らがある。
sen.e: His children were TACHIBANA no Kimisai, TACHIBANA no Kimiyori, and TACHIBANA no Yoshiko (Nyogo (wife) to Emperor Uda).

sen.j: 橘氏の初代・橘諸兄の6代孫にあたり、父・峯範より橘氏長者を継承した。
sen.e: He was the sixth generation grandson of TACHIBANA no Moroe, who was the first generation of Tachibana clan, and he succeeded Tachibanashi choja from his father, Minenori.

sen.j: 菅原是善に学び、陽成天皇、光孝天皇、宇多天皇の3代に仕え、近江国守、東宮学士、民部少輔、文章博士、式部大輔、勘解由長官、左大弁を歴任したのち、正四位下、参議となる。
sen.e: He learned under SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi, and served three emperors, Emperor Yozei, Koko, and Uda, became Shoshii no ge rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and Sangi (consultant) after he served as Omi no kuni no kami (lord of Omi Province), Togugakushi (tutor for the Imperial Prince), Minbu no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of Ministry of Popular Affairs), Monjohakase (Chinese scholar and secretary for the imperial court), Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Ministry of Ceremonial), Kageyu chokan, and Sadaiben.

He learned under SUGAWARA no Koreyoshi, and served three generations of emperors, Emperors Yozei, Koko, and Uda; became Shoshii no (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and Sangi (consultant) after serving as Omi no kuni no kami (Lord of Omi Province), Togugakushi (tutor for the Imperial Prince), Minbu no sho (Junior Assistant Minister of Ministry of Popular Affairs), Monjohakase (Chinese scholar and secretary for the imperial court), Shikibu no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Ministry of Ceremonial), Kageyu chokan, and Sadaiben.

sen.cmt: 役職名の表現を一部変更しました。

sen.j: 仁和3年（887年）、宇多天皇が関白に任じようとしていた藤原基経が、広相の起草した勅答に「阿衡に任ず」との文字があり、阿衡とは位のみで職掌が無い官であると激怒し出仕を拒否する阿衡事件が起こる。
sen.e: Fujiwara no Mototsune, whom Emperor Uda wanted to assign as the Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), became angry to the emperor's reply, "appoint to Ako" to the paper Hiromi wrote, claiming that Ako was just a rank without any official duties, and refused the appointment, causing the Ako case.

FUJIWARA no Mototsune, whom Emperor Uda wanted to assign as the Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), became angry at the emperor's reply, 'appoint to Ako,' which Hiromi wrote, claiming that Ako was just a rank without any official duties, and he refused the appointment, leading to the Ako Incident in 887.
sen.cmt: FUJIWARA と大文字にしました。the Ako Incident としました。

sen.j: 翌仁和4年（888年）、長期化する政務の停滞に心痛した天皇が基経の主張を受け入れ広相の非を認めたことから、広相は責を問われて失脚することとなった。
sen.e: Anguished over the delayed and lengthened political duties, emperor accepted suggestion by Mototsune and admitted the failure of Hiromi, and Hiromi lost his position while taking responsibility in 888.

Anguished over the delayed and lengthened political duties, the emperor accepted a suggestion by Mototsune and admitted the failure of Hiromi; Hiromi lost his position while taking responsibility in 888.

sen.cmt: 翌年 を追加しました。

sen.j: しかし、事件後に基経の娘が入内していることから、この事件は広相の娘・義子の産んだ皇子が即位し橘氏が天皇の外戚となることを警戒した藤原氏の陰謀によるものと云われる。
sen.e: However, since Mototsune's daughter went through judai (marriage to the emperor) after the incident, it was considered to be the scheme of the Fujiwara clan, who was wary of TACHIBANA becoming the maternal relative of the emperor by the assessment of the imperial prince of Yoshiko, who was the daughter of Hiromi.

However, because Mototsune's daughter entered Imperial Court as a Consort of the emperor after the incident, it was considered to be a scheme of the Fujiwara clan, who was wary of TACHIBANA becoming a maternal relative of the emperor by the accession of the imperial prince of Yoshiko, who was the daughter of Hiromi.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.e: He passed away on June 10, 890.

sen.j: 同日に従三位、中納言が追贈された。
sen.e: He was awarded posthumously with Jusani rank (Junior Third Rank), Chunagon (provisional middle councilor) on the same day.
On the same day, he was posthumously awarded Jusani (Junior Third Rank), Chunagon (provisional middle councilor).
